title: Air Canada to Resume Flights Amid Ongoing Strike, 100K+ Passengers Stranded
snippets: Air Canada will resume flights Monday evening, claiming the union illegally directed flight attendants to defy a return-to-work order.
Air Canada said it would delay its plans to restart operations to Monday evening. Some 100,000 people have been stranded amid flight cancellations.

Union to challenge order issued less than 12 hours after start of action that has left more than 100,000 travellers stranded

Air Canada‚Äôs flight attendants plan to remain on strike, their union has said, defying government efforts to force them back to work and into binding arbitration over
The decision by the union representing the 10,000 workers means that travel chaos will continue for at least a second day. Air Canada said it had suspended its reopening plan until Monday evening.
Air Canada flight attendants vow to defy a federal back-to-work order, as CUPE challenges the ruling and holds protests at major airports, demanding fair wages.
The shutdown of Canada‚Äôs largest airline early Saturday was impacting¬†about 130,000 people a day. Air Canada operates around 700 flights per day.

summary: Air Canada announced plans to resume flights on Monday evening after a strike by flight attendants, represented by CUPE, led to widespread cancellations, affecting around 130,000 passengers daily. The union has defied a federal back-to-work order, challenging its legality and continuing strikes for better wages, causing significant travel disruptions. This defiance comes despite Air Canada‚Äôs attempt to restart operations, leaving over 100,000 people stranded. The situation remains unresolved as the union and Air Canada navigate the ongoing dispute.

title: Trump and Putin Discuss Ukraine Peace, Agree on NATO-Style Guarantees
snippets: Steve Witkoff said Russia agreed in Alaska that the US and Europe could provide Ukraine with a Nato-style guarantee.
Special Envoy Steve Witkoff's remarks come just days after President Donald Trump met in Alaska with the Russian president to discuss ending the war in Ukraine.
European leaders, including from Britain, France and Germany, will join as Trump meets Zelensky in Washington after his Alaska summit with Putin.
President Trump offered security guarantees to deter future Russian aggression. But the offer was vague, prompting Kyiv to seek clarity.

NEW YORK (AP) ‚Äî Russian leader Vladimir Putin agreed at his summit with President Donald Trump that the United States and its European allies could offer Ukraine a security guarantee resembling NATO‚Äôs collective defense mandate as part of an eventual deal to end the war, a U.S. official said Sunday.

summary: During a summit in Alaska, President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin discussed ending the war in Ukraine. Putin agreed to let the U.S. and EU offer Ukraine NATO-style security guarantees, a significant move toward a potential peace deal. However, Trump's national security adviser, Rubio, expressed skepticism about the effectiveness of new sanctions on Russia to promote a ceasefire. This development marks a major step in diplomatic efforts to resolve the 3 1/2-year conflict in Ukraine.

Scottie Scheffler claimed a fifth victory of the PGA Tour season after Robert MacIntyre squandered a four-shot lead during the final round of the BMW Championship.

title: Jon Rahm Retains LIV Golf Points Title Despite No Event Wins
snippets: Jon Rahm is crowned as the LIV Golf individual champion for the second consecutive year, despite losing in a play-off to Sebastian Munoz in Indiana.
For the second year in a row, Rahm reigned supreme on LIV Golf by season's end

Jon Rahm successfully defended his LIV Golf season points title Sunday without winning an event all year, closing with an 11-under 60 before losing a playoff to Sebastian Munoz on the first extra hole in the Indianapolis event.

summary: Jon Rahm retained his LIV Golf season points title for the second consecutive year, despite not winning any event throughout the year. He concluded the season with an impressive 11-under 60 in Indianapolis, ultimately losing to Sebastian Munoz in a playoff on the first extra hole. Rahm's consistent performance throughout the season ensured his championship status, marking him as the LIV Golf individual champion once again.

title: Hurricane Erin Downgraded to Category 3, Threatens Caribbean with Heavy Rain
snippets: Heavy rain is still expected across the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico, with rainfall of up to 8 inches in some areas.

titles: Hurricane Erin downgraded to Category 3 storm

summary: Hurricane Erin, the first Atlantic hurricane of 2025, was downgraded to a Category 3 storm as it approached the Caribbean. Despite the downgrade, heavy rain is expected in the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico, with up to 8 inches forecasted in some areas. Tropical storm warnings have been issued for Turks and Caicos. Weather officials have warned of potential flash floods and landslides due to the storm's impact.

The protest, which followed a general strike, is part of wider protests across Israel against the government's military action in Gaza. Meanwhile, the US has responded to the situation by suspending visas for individuals from Gaza.

title: "85% Rule Suggests Speed Limits Based on Actual Driving Behaviors"
snippets: The 85% rule suggests a road‚Äôs posted speed should be tied to the 15th-fastest vehicle out of every 100 traveling it in free-flowing traffic.
titles: Today‚Äôs speed limits grew out of studies on rural roads from the 1930s and 1940s. Now states are looking to change guidelines
summary: The 85% rule recommends setting a road's speed limit based on the speed at which 85% of vehicles are traveling under free-flowing conditions, specifically the speed not exceeded by the 15th-fastest vehicle out of 100. This approach aims to create a realistic and enforceable speed limit that reflects actual driving behaviors.

title: New Geometric Structure Found, May Unlock Universe's Secrets

These projects aim to rejuvenate and safeguard natural environments and communities.
